data.title: Movie Review: Lord of Illusions (1995)
data.meta_description: This is one of the stranger and more interesting films I’ve seen in a while. It’s directed by Clive Barker, and based one one of his short stories that features his recurring character of occult…
data.text:
This is one of the stranger and more interesting films I’ve seen in a while. It’s directed by Clive Barker, and based one one of his short stories that features his recurring character of occult investigator Harry D’Amour, played by Scott Bakula in a solid performance.

The plot is honestly very difficult to describe, both because I want to avoid spoilers and because it just is genuinely so weird. I definitely recommend the movie, but it gets very silly frequently. It doesn’t have a consistent tone, but it is consistently interesting.

Rating: 6/10
